metatags.twitter:description: The records are part of a defamation lawsuit brought by Virginia Giuffre, an alleged victim of Epstein, against his longtime companion Ghislaine Maxwell.

website_content.content: A new round of from a lawsuit related to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were released Monday, which include photos from an accuser as well as an exhibit that mentions discredited allegations she made about Bill Clinton, Donald Trump, Prince Andrew and Richard Branson. At least 17 documents were unsealed. have been released since Wednesday. The records are part of a defamation lawsuit brought by Virginia Giuffre, an alleged victim of Epstein, against his longtime companion Ghislaine Maxwell that the two settled in 2017. Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges. Maxwell is serving a 20-year prison sentence after she was convicted in 2021 of aiding Epstein's sex trafficking of young women and girls. Her appeal will be heard in March. ! Jeffrey Epstein's longtime companion Ghislaine Maxwell is seen on E... United States District Court Southern District of New York The documents unsealed Monday include several photographs produced by Sarah Ransome, who filed a lawsuit against Epstein, Maxwell and other alleged co-conspirators in 2017 under the pseudonym "Jane Doe 43." Ransome was also involved in the Giuffre case as a witness. She was deposed and provided dozens of photographs showing Epstein, Maxwell, herself and other young women on Epstein's private island. According to another unsealed filing, Ransome testified that some of the pictures were taken by Jean Luc Brunel, a French model scout and associate of Epstein, and given to her by him. ! Sarah Ransome, who filed a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislain... United States District Court Southern District of New York Brunel in his prison cell in February 2022 while awaiting trial on charges of rape of underage girls and sexual harassment -- a crime in France. Brunel had maintained he was innocent. Several of the photographs ... [Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: ABC News is a well-established news organization that provides a variety of accurate news reports and investigative journalism. While it has a reputable stance in the media landscape, it is sometimes critiqued for sensationalism, especially in breaking news coverage. Nonetheless, its overall reliability and efforts in fact-checking score it highly.

ContentScore.Newness Justification: The article was published on January 9, 2024, making it quite recent and relevant to current discussions on Jeffrey Epstein's activities.
ContentScore.Relevance Justification: While it mentions Epstein’s trafficking and his private island, it does not directly link to the specific video in question, so the relevance is moderate.

No really PLEASE do explain," . It was flagged as part of Facebook’s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed. (Read more about our .) A spokesperson for Clinton did not immediately respond to our questions about the Facebook post. Jeffrey Epstein, the late financier and convicted sex offender, and other high-profile public figures, such as President Donald Trump. metatags.og:title: What's true and false about Jeffrey Epstein and the individuals on his list
metatags.og:description: A roundup of claims about Jeffrey Epstein and his former girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell.
metatags.twitter:creator: @usatoday
metatags.article:author: Hannah Hudnall
metatags.twitter:description: A roundup of claims about Jeffrey Epstein and his former girlfriend Ghislaine Maxwell.

website_content.content: Jeffrey Epstein's trial and associates have long been fruitful ground for misinformation, including baseless claims about his flight log and a bevy of altered photos wrongly linking Epstein to high-profile figures. A new crop of false claims began circulating Jan. 3 after were unsealed in U.S. District Court in New York. **More**: **More**: Here's a roundup of the latest Epstein fact checks from the USA TODAY Fact-Check Team, along with some highlights from our archive: **More from the Fact-Check Team:** | | Claims after documents were unsealed Jan. 3 ------------------------------------------- **Claim: Former President Barack Obama was with Jeffrey Epstein in a boat with a girl** _Our rating: False_ Obama was not with Epstein in the boat. The photo shows Obama with the actor George Clooney during a boat ride in Italy in June 2019. Epstein is not present in this photo. **Claim: Anderson Cooper and Kathy Griffin are named in the Jeffrey Epstein documents** _Our rating: False_ Neither Griffin nor Cooper are listed in any of the documents related to the late financier and accused sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein. **Claim: Jeffrey Epstein documents and Anthony Weiner laptop prove Hillary Clinton visited Epstein Island 6 times** _Our rating: False_ The Epstein documents unsealed in January don't contain any proof that Clinton visited the island. She was listed as a possible witness, not accused of any wrongdoing. The emails found on former New York Rep. Anthony Weiner's laptop are unrelated and were unsealed back in 2017. **Claim: Photo shows Taylor Swift posing with Jeffrey Epstein** _Our rating: Altered_ The man shown in the photo is music executive Monte Lipman, not Jeffrey Epstein. The image was first shared in 2021, two years after Epstein died by suicide. **Claim: Oprah Winfrey, Barack Obama are among more than 160 confirmed visitors to Epstein Island** _Our ... [Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: USA Today offers a wide range of national and international news and is generally known for accuracy. However, it has sometimes been criticized for its emphasis on brevity and simplicity, which can lead to oversimplification of complex issues. Despite this, it maintains a solid reputation for news accuracy.

ContentScore.Newness Justification: The article is from January 3, 2024, which is fairly recent but not the newest evidence available.
ContentScore.Relevance Justification: It indicates the absence of evidence connecting claims to Epstein's island but does not provide direct information about the video, hence, it is moderately relevant.

website_content.content: The unsealing of documents related to Epstein reignited rumors about his past connections to former presidents and celebrities. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### Published Jan. 12, 2024 Rumors about Jeffrey Epstein’s inner circle filled social feeds in early 2024 after a related to his sexual abuse of teenage girls. While the to what was about Epstein’s offenses, they gave fodder to people eager to fictionalize the late, convicted sex offender’s impact on high-profile people and evidence of his crimes. From fake photos generated by to , several misleading pieces of media circulated widely in tandem with the documents' release. Here's a sample: * . Although there are of the two together ( a “terrific guy” and in the recently unsealed documents), this image of them on a plane, in particular, is fake. * at a hospital recently to distract the public from the aforementioned documents. The footage was actually from 2021. ( also appeared in the newly released records.) * playing with paper airplanes while sitting in front of two collapsed Jenga towers. While the painting is real, there’s no credible evidence to confirm (or disprove) Epstein owned it. * . In reality, the man is Monte Lipman, the CEO of Republic Records. * . No evidence connected the video to him. * . There were telltale signs of the photo being fake. For instance, the faces of people in the background are deformed and Trump has only one leg. Think you’ve come across a fake photo or miscaptioned video involving Epstein? for potential fact-checking. Not all rumors linking Epstein to former presidents are made up. For instance, showing Trump with two of his children, Ivanka and Eric, alongside Epstein in the ‘90s is real, as well as that was taken a few years later including Melania Trump and Epstein’s longtime partner, Ghislaine ... [Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Snopes is the go-to website for debunking myths, rumors, and misinformation. It employs a rigorous process for investigating claims and is widely recognized for its accuracy and thoroughness. Snopes has solid credibility in identifying fake news and providing consumers with fact-checked information.

ContentScore.Newness Justification: This evidence is from January 12, 2024, making it the most up-to-date source regarding claims about Epstein's activities.
ContentScore.Relevance Justification: Clearly states that there is no evidence connecting the video of young girls to Epstein’s island, making it highly relevant to the claim in question.

website_content.content: The UK's Prince Andrew and Bill Clinton are among high-profile figures named in US court papers detailing connections of late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The newly released records form part of a case against Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's girlfriend who has been jailed for helping him abuse girls. But the documents so far unveil no major new allegations about Epstein nor revelations about his associates. Prince Andrew is accused of groping a woman, which he denies. Other names in the documents include singer Michael Jackson and magician David Copperfield, though no wrongdoing is alleged. Mr Clinton appears in a number of the documents. The former US president has acknowledged being a former associate of Epstein but has strongly denied he had any knowledge of his crimes. The first files from the much-hyped trove - covering about 900 pages - were released on Wednesday, after an order by New York Judge Loretta Preska, who acknowledged many of those named had already been identified by the media or in Maxwell's criminal trial. Judge Preska said that many others did not raise an objection to the release of the documents. However, she ordered that some names remain redacted because they would identify victims of sexual abuse. Some of the more than 100 people on the list make allegations about other individuals, or are potential witnesses, and more documents are expected to be released in the coming days. Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from a minor in 2009 and took his own life in 2019 while awaiting trial over sex-trafficking charges. The files include references to Johanna Sjoberg, who has claimed that Prince Andrew groped her breast while sitting on a couch inside Epstein's Manhattan apartment in 2001. Buckingham Palace has previously said her allegations are "categorically untrue". It has declined to comment on ... [Content truncated]

It follows strict editorial guidelines to maintain neutrality and truthfulness. Although it has faced criticism over perceived biases, its worldwide reach and reliability in reporting factual news still place it among the top credible news sources.

ContentScore.Relevance Justification: It addresses names mentioned in court files, but it doesn’t specifically comment on the video being assessed, giving it a moderate relevance score.

website_content.content: Introduction ------------ In a shocking turn of events, new videos have surfaced online claiming to show young girls inside a mysterious temple on the notorious island of Jeffrey Epstein. The billionaire, who died in prison in 2019, has been the subject of countless conspiracy theories and speculation about his involvement in a vast network of sexual exploitation. The recently released video has sparked renewed interest and outrage over the secrets and crimes that are yet to be unveiled about Little St James Island. , which was shared on various platforms, allegedly reveals young girls engaging in playful activities within the confines of Epstein's Island. The caption accompanying the video, written in Spanish, left viewers with more questions than answers, questioning what was happening and why these girls were there. However, it is important to note that there is currently no concrete evidence to support the claim that the viral video indeed depicts girls on Epstein's island. To understand the controversy surrounding this viral video, we must first revisit the dark history of Jeffrey Epstein. The wealthy financier and convicted sex offender was at the center of a high-profile scandal that rocked the world. He was arrested in 2019 on charges of sex trafficking young girls but died in jail before he could face justice. His death left many unanswered questions and fueled numerous conspiracy theories surrounding his alleged involvement with powerful individuals and his extensive criminal activities. Fast forward to early 2024, when a judge ordered the unsealing of documents in a lawsuit filed against Epstein's associate and partner in crime, Ghislaine Maxwell. These documents shed light on the extent of Epstein's activities and caused a frenzy on social media. Rumors and speculations ran rampant, and the viral video added fuel to the already burning fire. However, thorough examination and ... [Content truncated]

While it offers a variety of information, the credibility and fact-checking processes behind the reporting are not as robust as those from established organizations. Caution is recommended due to the potential for misinformation from less reliable sources.

ContentScore.Newness Justification: Published in January 2024, this article is up-to-date with current events surrounding Epstein’s controversy.
ContentScore.Relevance Justification: Directly states there is no concrete evidence linking the viral videos to Epstein's island, making it highly relevant to verifying the claim.

website_content.content: Another set of related to the late financier and convicted sex offender was released Thursday, many of them focusing on how teen girls were recruited to go to his Florida home. Some of the depositions released Thursday center on how girls were convinced to go to the home and then were asked to bring friends for additional payment. One woman who was 16 or 17 at the time said she had no massage experience and no assumption or expectation that the visit would involve sexual activity. “Jeffrey took my clothes off without my consent the first time I met him,” according to a transcript of a deposition from the woman, whose name has been redacted. Former Palm Beach police Det. Joseph Recarey, who is now deceased, said in 2016 that Ghislaine Maxwell, , was involved in seeking girls to give massages and work at Epstein’s home. Recarey said he interviewed around 33 women, according to a transcript. Only two, who were older, had any massage experience, he said. Most of the girls were younger than 18. "Each of the victims that went to the home were asked to bring their friends to the home. Some complied and some didn’t," Recarey said. The descriptions of how women were recruited contained in the documents is consistent with what was testified to at Maxwell’s criminal trial. Nineteen exhibits totaling 327 pages of previously sealed documents were released Thursday by a federal court in New York. The disclosure is part of a settled lawsuit first filed in 2015 against British socialite and Epstein confidant by , who said she was a victim of sex trafficking and abuse when she was a teenager in the early 2000s. In total, the hundreds of pages of unsealed documents — which are the latest to attract in the ... [Content truncated]

While it generally provides reliable reporting, it has occasionally been accused of bias, especially concerning political coverage. However, its commitment to fact-checking and journalistic integrity ranks it highly.

website_content.content: # United States District Court Southern District of New York Virginia L. Giuffre, Plaintiff, Case No.: 15-cv-07433-RWS v. Ghislaine Maxwell, Defendant. ________________________________/ PLAINTIFFS’ RESPONSE TO DEFENDANT’S MOTION FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT Sigrid McCawley BOIES, SCHILLER & FLEXNER LLP 401 E. Las Olas Blvd., Suite 1200 Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33301 (954) 356-0011 Case 18-2868, Document 280, 08/09/2019, 2628232, Page1 of 74 i TABLE OF CONTENTS Page I. PRELIMINARY STATEMENT .........................................................................................1 II. UNDISPUTED FACTS.......................................................................................................4 A. It is an Undisputed Fact That Multiple Witnesses Deposed in This Case Have Testified That Defendant Operated as Convicted Pedophile Jeffrey Epstein’s Procurer of Underage Girls......................................................................................4 1. It is an undisputed fact that Joanna Sjoberg testified Defendant lured her from her school to have sex with Epstein under the guise of hiring her for a job answering phones....................................................................4 2. It is an undisputed fact that Tony Figueroa testified that Defendant would call him to bring over underage girls and that Defendant and Epstein would have threesomes with Ms. Giuffre.......................................6 3. It is an undisputed fact that Rinaldo Rizzo testified that Defendant took the passport of a 15-year-old Swedish girl and threatened her when she refused to have sex with Epstein. ................................................8 4. It is an undisputed fact that Lyn Miller testified that she believed Defendant became Ms. Giuffre’s “new mama”...........................................9 5. It is an undisputed Fact that Detective Joseph Recarey testified that he sought to investigate Defendant in relation to his investigation of Jeffrey Epstein. ............................................................................................9 6. It is an undisputed fact that Pilot David Rodgers testified that he flew Defendant and Ms. Giuffre at least 23 times on Epstein’s jet, the “Lolita Express” and that “GM” on the flight logs Stands for Ghislaine Maxwell.....................................................................................................10 7. It is an undisputed fact that Sarah Kellen, Nadia Marcinkova, and Jeffrey Epstein invoked the fifth amendment when asked about Defendant trafficking ... [Content truncated]
